reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the National response for Malaria Control in Angola

description.narrative: Angola - Malaria - World Vision International - WV - HQ. This program has the following goals: Reduce the malaria prevalence among children age 6 - 59 months by 60% from 14% in 2016 to 6% by 2020. Reduce the malaria-related mortality (number of malaria deaths per 1000 population) by 60% from 53,8% in 2016 to 21,5% by 2020. The objectives of this program are: By the end of 2020, at least 80% of the target population uses an adequate preventive measure;. By the end of 2020, 100% of suspected malaria cases at health facility, private pharmacies and community levels are tested before receiving treatment;. By the end of 2020, 100% of malaria cases testing positive are treated according to the national guidelines, at all levels of the national health pyramid, including at community level;. By the end of 2020, ensure that the Angolan population uses at least 80% of the planned malaria control interventions;. By 2020, strengthen the epidemiology surveillance system, monitoring and evaluation and operational research;. By 2020, strengthen the management, technical and institutional capacities of the National Malaria Control Program (NMCP) at all levels, to enable efficient and sustainable implementation of the planned activities of the NMCP.

title.narrative: Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
M&E-Other 1: One or more indicators of community-based treatment for diarrhea, pneumonia and/or malaria are included in the national HMIS
CM-Other 1: Proportion of children recommended for referral by ADECOS who are received at the referral facility
CSS-Other 3: Proportion of CHWs who received at least one supervisory contact in the prior 3 months during which registers and/or reports were reviewed
CSS-Other 1: Proportion of CHWs trained who are providing services as per the TOR 1 year after initial training
CSS- other 4: Number of NGOs whose organizational capacity has been strengthened;
CSS-other 5: Proportion of ADECOSs trained in iCCM who are providing iCCM 1 year after initial training
CSS-Other 2: Proportion of ADECOS who received at least one supervisory contact in the prior 3 months during which registers and/or reports were reviewed
PSM-other 1: Percentage of iCCM sites reporting no stock-outs of key iCCM essential drugs in the past month
M&E-Other 2: Proportion of districts reporting complete iCCM data on time
